content.label: Well-balanced casual tactics game, super fun to play. Mika knows how to make great games!

One of the best RTS games on the AppStore! I wish they added multiplayer option so that we can play online and also add spectators if we wanted to just watch verses the AI. The AI is not that bad but I feel like it‚Äôs the same thing over and over so it‚Äôs easy to expect what the AI will possibly get or do. Also, please update for latest iPhones and iPads. Thank you!!

title.label: One of the best turn-based strategy games

content.label: I play a lot of turn based strategy games on my pc, but when I‚Äôm traveling I have to play mobile games, and when I was looking for mobile games, I found lost frontier. This game blew me away, and this game is a lot better than even some of the games on my pc. The story is great, and it is one of the few mobile games that actually has a good storyline. The combat is really good, as it is simple to learn, but you can do so much with it. The campaign is the best part imo, but the challenge and custom maps are also fun. Also, it is really cool unlocking new abilities for your character as you go along. On top of that, to fully upgrade any character it‚Äôs only $.99, so the max you can spend in the game is only $9, and you really don‚Äôt need to pay anything as it‚Äôs not pay to win at all. I have never written a game review before, but this game is so good that I had too.
Difficult, rewarding, and so much fun. the time passes insanely fast when I play this.

title.label: Nice graphics, sound and art however..

content.label: There are a few minute details which high end turn based strategy games feature. One day into the game, I find myself not knowing how to check or accepting a serious flaw in the game. We are unable to view the range for our own units. We are unable view any information about the terrain, also. For instance, clicking or holding your finger on a unit should serve a purpose to display ranged attack length or unit information. Recruiting is annoying because everytime you view a unit, they prompt a 2 sentence pop up of information which increases time to select your unit. We should also be able to station units on saloons or homes. I‚Äôm also not sure if ranger attacks can go through them? They‚Äôre are so many mesas as well but shouldn‚Äôt we be able to place our units on them, or on hills. Also the menu buttons are way to close, they feature similar font and size. So often I will click on a different button than I desire, as they‚Äôre placed on the top right. I‚Äôd prefer more copy and paste of advance wars , Lost Frontier is old but there is much untapped potential.

Mika Mobile has done it again!  I love this one, Mika Mobile‚Äôs charming graphics shine.  It feels great to strategize your turns and beat a level.  It‚Äôs challenging but very fair; although some levels get a bit hairy, if you keep a cool head you can beat most on the first try (and I think I make a good number of mistakes)

title.label: what great game with no loot box garbage

content.label: This plays a lot like advance wars/command and conquer.  Way better than any other iOS games I‚Äôve played in similar vein.
was looking for something similar to Advance Wars... decided to try this one... & i‚Äôm glad i did.  this is a fun and challenging strategy game.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong this game is amazing but I feel like there could be more as in maps, Troops
Etc there is a custom mode but what if that added a creative mode where you can place buildings your self and then play said level but honestly This game is defiantly worth the money
Too many glictches can‚Äôt select troops screen moves

This is one of my all time favorite games. A strategy game that gives you time to think. RPG upgrade elements that keep you coming back to beat just one more level. A great setting, and polished graphics. The controls are perfect for the phone or iPad. I wish all games were this well crafted.

It is difficult! It sometimes takes me four or five tries to beat a level, but that difficulty makes it all the more worth it.

Only two changes could make the game better: online multiplayer (please!!) and allow achievements to be shared with other living legends. Otherwise, this game is perfect.

Just one more time I have to say that I love the style. The simplicity of the menus, the cartoonish characters, and the satisfying controls. A very well crafted game. An incomplete sentence.

This game is super under-rated‚Äîit‚Äôs great turn-based strategy. If you like Advance Wars, or Warbits, or Fire Emblem, Lost Frontier is totally worth trying out.

The teams are asymmetric too, with some interesting differences between the sides.

I wish the UI was a little clearer about which units were good/bad against which, but that‚Äôs relatively minor.

It‚Äôs a game like Advance War on GBA. Recalled my childhood good summer vacation with friends.

One-stop buy a Full-game, without any in-app purchase or ADs.

Awesome graphic and BGM, included story mode and challenge maps.

iCloud save state restore supported! You can play continue your save stage on iPhone or iPad, switch easily. Don‚Äôt worry for lost save process even you lost your iPhone. 

But, I found few little bugs, e.g. enemy hero‚Äôs special power disappeared when I restart the game. Unlimited moves in one round, when I click ‚Äùend turn‚Äù then exit the app from background. And this game had no updates more than 2 years after last update. Even so, it‚Äôs my favorite game on my iPhone.

Looking forward lost frontier 2!

Could someone either open-source this or charge me $20 for a DLC expansion (just more maps, minimal effort). There simply isn‚Äôt anything else with this classic TBS format & perfect iPhone play. Kills me that it‚Äôs just sitting and growing dusty.

My favorite iPhone game so far. I have searched obsessively for a turn based strategy game that incorporated terrain, unit types, capturing & defending space and am really glad I finally found Lost Frontier. It‚Äôs perfectly formatted for an iPhone screen, is easy to pick up and has alot of depth and enjoyable challenges in the campaigns. My only regret is that having finished the game twice there is no second version to buy. Well worth the trivial price and a great relief from the litany of ‚Äúfree to play‚Äù junk. Saddle up!

Fun game. I just beat the story games all toons max level all 3 stars all the way to level 24 on each, 3 stared all challenge maps with every character which is very hard to do and to my dismay no programmers egg congratulation for taking the time and beating the game.

Truly as good as any turn-based strategy game, and with a neat design. I had a hard time around level 5 or 6, but as with any strategy game just had to walk away and clear my mind before starting the level again with a new strategy, which worked first time. This is old-school strategy, where you have to expect to lose occasionally. That just makes it even more rewarding to figure it out and beat it.

If you like Advance Wars with a western-ish steampunk-ish twist, this is the game for you.

SUGGESTIONS:
- Fix for map images not appearing in Custom Game
- Map Editor and maybe a way to share custom maps

This game is the closest thing I‚Äôve found. The game feels polished and the story is just interesting enough to give some context to the levels. 

This game has same device multiplayer which was really fun to play.

I did miss a ‚Äúfog of war‚Äù. I think it‚Äôd add a lot. 

Thanks for the great game!

The star objectives are too hard forcing frequent level restarts to achieve them but the is no ‚Äúrestart‚Äù option so one has to surrender, exit the level, tap through all of the story dialog again. Frustrating. Really bad user experience.

I can‚Äôt say enough about this game. I‚Äôve played through almost all the campaigns and challenge maps and have easily logged 100+ hours. I get lost in this game sometimes and the hours just slip by. The more you learn about each of the characters and the posses and the tanks, how they move and the damage they do on others...well, it‚Äôs a steady learning curve but so worth the time when you get that Victory! salute from the game. Of all the PlayStation and iOS games I‚Äôve played, this one ranks near the very top. Purchased this a year ago and still playing and enjoying it. I highly recommend this for someone looking for a challenge with a great rewards system. I hope someday soon there is a Lost Frontier 2 because I will instantly pre-order it.
I love the game this game and I play it with my friends but if you are new to strategy games this is not for you

Other reviews have complained about it being too hard etc. especially one review that discusses chapter 4. I just came here to say that they were wrong because they did not read the instructions in the game (it is all explained in chapters 1-4), it‚Äôs not insanely difficult, you just have to learn the mechanics of the game. As far as creativity in solutions, meh. Yeah to get 3 stars you‚Äôll probably be kind of confined in your solution, but it really is more of a puzzle style game if your goal is to 3star every mission. Not a negative, it‚Äôs just more of a ‚Äúsolution‚Äù based game at that point

Love Mika Mobile, love grid-based strategy games. I‚Äôve cut my teeth on every fire emblem game I could get my hands on as well as the final fantasy tactics games and advance wars. When I heard Mika had made a strategy game, suffice to say I was excited! Sadly though, after playing for about 15 hours I honestly think I‚Äôm done with the game for good. The problem isn‚Äôt that this game is too hard, it‚Äôs that there‚Äôs only one ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù way to do each mission. Basically each map is just a boring game of trial and error till you figure out the exact moves to finish the level with 3 stars. You just don‚Äôt get that rush of creative excitement that a fire emblem game affords you. I wish so badly that I could recommend this game to fans of the genre, but truthfully I suggest you pass on this one and try the Partia games if you‚Äôre looking for a strategy fix.

title.label: Advance Wars Fans you‚Äôve found it

content.label:
I have been waiting for this game for years. I‚Äôve seen advance wars clones, but the way this game adds in the undead really adds a wonderfully different spin. Also, it fictionally uses healing and taking land much differently than AW, resulting in fresh gameplay.

My only frustrations are:
1.) you don‚Äôt get ANY bonus for getting all 3-stars in story and/or challenge maps?!? At least throw us an extra level!
2.) Can we PLEASE get an expansion at some point? Making custom games just isn‚Äôt the same as intentional scenarios.

EVERY attack by your team has the frustrating problem of always leaving 1 health on your enemy. Very cheap move by Mika to make the game more difficult. How do they do this? Your attack has a range of damage, say for example 40-60. Guess what? It‚Äôs never 60, it‚Äôs ALWAYS 40. 

Such a great game being made bad by poor decisions on gameplay.

title.label: Advanced Wars in the Wild West

content.label:
I‚Äôm surprised people aren‚Äôt making the comparison. Some of the maps even felt the same.  This is a compliment. Advanced Wars was one of my favorite games. 

My only complaint is that I don‚Äôt think all of the extra challenge maps are winnable with every hero, for example the ones that can‚Äôt capture structures.  Also, it would be nice to turn off the tutorial and intro dialogue after the first time. 

Highly recommended game.  Challenging. Lot of strategy. Nice atmosphere.  In-game purchases are perfect. Sequel please.

title.label: If you like strategy games - this one is for you.

content.label: Love this game. It is a good length game but also has replay value. Love replaying the game as different characters and coming up with different strategies for that characters strength. wish there were more games like this. I like this game better than Banner Saga-  Developer should consider releasing this game on the switch (banner saga already has).

This game is perfect.  Story is great.  Gameplay is great.  Graphics are amazing.  Sound and music is perfect.  Love it.  

Also, Not sure why people are saying this is too hard...  I beat everything with 3 stars and wanted it to be more difficult so I selected Ghast and beat it with 3 stars without using the hero or any of the graveyard units.  I gotta try to beat it without air units now.  It has tons of replay value in my opinion.  Thanks for my favorite game on the App Store!

Lost Frontier has all the makings to be a great TBS game: a big studio, nice artwork, sound logic, but it‚Äôs got a LOT of design flaws to help the gaming experience. 

1) Option to zoom out on the battlefield map - the map is really big and dense. This is the most annoying feature missing imo. It's cumbersome to keep dragging the map around to memorize all the position of your enemies

2) No Surrender & Replay on the same level - Sometimes I'd like to start over without having to go back to the main menu

3) No skip button on dialogue - In that vein, if I want to replay a level I don't want to have to tap through all the dialogue

title.label: Fantastic Game, needs updated, keeps crashing on new IOS

content.label:
I play this game every day at work to pass time. It now crashes with IOS 11 updates, and needs updated PLEASE!!!
My Favorite Game on IOS, and soon it won‚Äôt run at all! Please Update this Fantastic Turn Based Strategy Game.

title.label: Was fun at first, but gets stupid hard fast

content.label: Game was going well and fun, then with no warning, you have to fight six times as many enemies AND incredibly strong werewolves that also outnumber you AND you are trapped in a corner AND you can‚Äôt build more troops.  Progress stops at that point.  Very unfair!

title.label: Best turn based strategy game on iOS.

content.label:
If you like final fantasy tactics then this is a great game for you. Takes some time to master and has a few challenges but is certainly worth the money.  You will struggle to pass higher levels until your main character is maxed  at lvl 40, so either pay the extra 99 cents or plan to grind it out.  After completing the game with one of the three base characters you unlock a number of additional characters and can play the game through with them. 
My one request for a functionality update would be the ability to skip the tutorials on rounds that you have played before as there is no need to see them again and again with new characters.
The game gets super hard very quickly.  I have loved Mika Mobiles other games, and I want to love this one.  By the time you get to chapter 4, forget it.
When it‚Äôs not constantly crashing.

title.label: Outstanding game when it isn't crashing

content.label:
From a gameplay perspective, this is a 5* game. Yes, it is hard, Yes, you won't always get 3 stars on every level the first time you play it. But each level is possible to ace once you level your hero or unlock other leaders to play through.

I just can't give it that deserved 5* rating though because the latest update crashes every few turns, sometimes even failing to launch. Fix that, and I'll change this rating.
Running it on a 6S Plus, and it crashes once every 2-3 minutes, almost unplayable. Would be great if it worked....

I absolutely love this game's mix of advance wars style gameplay and Weird West plot. More games should aspire to take the best elements of good stuff and mix it together into a well-polished, fun and affordable game experience that doesn't load you down with micro transactions! Sadly, the game crashes on me constantly - about every other turn it'll freeze up and about every third time I launch it it'll crash. 

My advice as a game dev - take a few sprints and invest in automated testing, guys. It'll pay dividends in ways you can't imagine.
Awful

Started out fun...but difficulty sky rockets making the game not fun and too much time waiting around to earn cash or level up your hero in order to even come close to being able to clear the stage.  I play tons of tactical games and this one just too overwhelming....art is great and sound is good....they just really need to balance the difficulty or offer an option to adjust the difficulty so people don't feel like they wasted their money.
I never get bored of this game.   Devilishly challenging at times, finally a turn based game that's easy to figure out but very complex to beat at times.   Five stars stick with it if you get stuck
This is a great game! However there are lots of bugs that need to be fixed!
Fun but way too unbalanced to be enjoyable after the first few missions. I want to enjoy the well done game dynamics but can't.

This game is not unplayably hard. If you have trouble playing it, then you are not a fan of strategy games or any sort of critical thinking. You just like getting free wins from moving units forward across maps.

I have played and beaten every single one of Mika Mobile's games. Their art style in unique. Their ideas always stand out. They make solid and simple games with a lot of depth hidden under the artwork and story. None of their games are as easy as they look, and that's what makes them a great developer. Keep up the great work! I check up on you on the App Store about once a month, just in case you drop something new. I'm not positive, but I believe this is an indie developer. They only release a new game every year or two. Again, their games are always good though. You are the first and only developer I know by screen name. Keep it up, and I hope you have made a decent living for yourself making these great games!

I am a HUGE turn based strategy fan and was hooked on this game. Good variety of units and like the fact we have a more powerful "Hero". There is some trial and error to figure out the harder levels but a very fun game and hope for a sequel üòÄ

Only thing on wishlist for any sequel would be to add some cutomized RPG character attributes. 

Great job Mika Mobile!üëç

i love these kind of games (starting with the original "empire - wargame of the century" 20 years ago) and this one is the best of its kind. several people here say it is too hard. i find the dificulty perfect. a good challenge but far from impossible. also one needs to do the story mode first. anyway, a very well thought out and tested game.

This obviously takes homage to GBA Advanced wars series but with a western twist.  This is a really good turn based strategy game.  Graphics are crisp and the gameplay is solid.  The AI can be dumb at times but it still is a challenge. It's worth the purchase if you like advanced wars.

I have been looking and waiting for a game like this for years after the last advanced wars game. Not only is this game mobile I'm so happy that I can have it on my phone to take with me wherever I go and be able to play it with friends (multiplayer) whenever I want. This is possible the greatest app I've ever paid for, $2.99 with no in app purchases is a steal for this sort of game. The units are diverse and bring many fun new ideas to mix that we're all used to in these sorts of games. The game mechanics and rules have been tweaked slightly as well somewhat upping the challenge. I like the new combat system as it now allows for a chance to deal a varied amount of damage each time you attack. The story is good as well. One of my new favorite additions to the genera is the day and night cycle that effects certain units which makes you strategize even more. Some people complain that the levels are far to hard, this is true but they're not impossible although some may take you a few tries (level 9 for instance) you're also able to choose hero characters to command your troops and supply buffs to certain units as well. The music and sound effects are top notch and make me feel like I truly am in the Wild West (when playing with headphones). Basically I love this game and if you've ever played an advanced wars game I know you'll love this one to. No other game has made me ramble on in a review this much.

5/5

10/10 

100/100

A perfect game for a great price
The game concept is solid.  However it quickly becomes way too hard to be any fun.  Can't recommend

title.label: Exactly what I look for in a Tactical RPG

content.label: This game does tactical turn based combat the right way. There are no annoying mobile freemium mechanics, just a beautifully simple, yet tactically complex game, for a straightforward price. This game is worth $30, but I paid $3. Awesome!!
